text: (a) They are all equal to 1. Let us show this using the spectral decomposition. Let Q be orthogonal with SVD given by Q@ = USV”. Then QTQ = I = VETUTULVT = VETSVT, from which it follows that £7% = I and hence all singular values are 1. (b) Not quite unique, for example U and V' are only determined up to sign. There is a bit more to say here, but let’s leave it at this.
